column1: Perusal of the judgment revealed that the trial Court was mindful of

the  legal  position  in  relation  to 
the  Accused-Appellant.  This  is  evident
from  the  pronouncement by the  trial  Court that the evidence adduced by

the  Accused-Appellant  had  failed 
to 
raise  a 
reasonable  doubt 
in 
the
prosecution case.  Clearly the  trial Court had not imposed any burden  on

the  Accused-Appellant.  The  basis  of 
the  complaint  of 
the  Accused

Appellant is  the  wording  that  had  been 
used  in  the  analysis  of  defence
